snippet: Staff Sgt. Jimmy Moriarty, who was fatally shot along with two other American trainers on Friday, had told relatives the day before that everything was “hunky-dory.”...
abstract: United States and Jordan begin joint investigation of killings of three American soldiers, including Staff Sgt Jimmy Moriarty, at hands of Jordanian soldier at King Faisal air base; family of Moriarty has expressed doubt about only account of shootings that has been given so far.

byline.contributor: Ranya Kadri contributed reporting from Amman, Jordan, and Eric Schmitt and Helene Cooper from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Staff Sgt. Jimmy Moriarty, who was fatally shot along with two other American trainers on Friday, had told relatives the day before that everything was “hunky-dory.”

headline.main: Few Answers for the Family of a U.S. Soldier Slain in Jordan
headline.print_headline: U.S. and Families Seek Answers in Deaths of 3 Trainers in Jordan

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
